meanings.definition: A loud, resonant sound or noise
meanings.sent1: The clangours of the construction work echoed through the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The clangours of the bells filled the air with a joyful noise.
meanings.sent3: The clangours of the pots and pans clashing together made a chaotic symphony in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The clangours of battle drums signaled the start of the ancient war.
meanings.sent5: The clangours of the thunderstorm shook the windows and rattled the doors.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, resonant sound or noise
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith clangours the hammer against the anvil to shape the metal.
meanings.sent2: The church bells clangours every hour, marking the passage of time.
meanings.sent3: The children clangours their pots and pans together to create a makeshift band.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock clangours loudly, waking up the entire household.
meanings.sent5: The marching band clangours their instruments in perfect harmony during the parade.
